Optimal Binning for Numerical Features using MDLP

optimal_binning_numerical_mdlp.Rd

This function performs optimal binning on a numerical feature using the Minimum Description Length Principle (MDLP).

Usage

optimal_binning_numerical_mdlp(
  target,
  feature,
  min_bins = 3L,
  max_bins = 5L,
  bin_cutoff = 0.05,
  max_n_prebins = 20L,
  convergence_threshold = 1e-06,
  max_iterations = 1000L
)

Arguments

target

An integer vector containing binary target values (0 or 1).

feature

A numeric vector containing the feature values to be binned.

min_bins

The minimum number of bins to produce.

max_bins

The maximum number of bins to produce.

bin_cutoff

The minimum proportion of records allowed in a bin.

max_n_prebins

The maximum number of pre-bins to create.

convergence_threshold

The convergence threshold for the algorithm.

max_iterations

The maximum number of iterations allowed.

Value

A list containing the binning results, including bins, WoE, IV, counts, cutpoints, convergence status, and iterations run.
